snippet: Five years after the financial crisis arrived, European households remain extremely reluctant about big purchases like automobiles.
abstract: European Automobile Manufacturers Assn reports car sales fell again, reaching their lowest level in 20 years as European households remain reluctant about big purchases like automobiles; sales dropped 5.9 percent, to 1.04 million units, smallest number of vehicles sold in month of May since 1993.

byline.contributor: Jack Ewing contributed reporting from Frankfurt.

lead_paragraph: Five years after the financial crisis arrived, European households remain extremely reluctant about big purchases like automobiles.

headline.main: In Europe, Sales of Cars Hit Their Lowest Level in 20 Years
headline.print_headline: In Europe, Sales of Cars Hit Their Lowest Level in 20 Years
